item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. CUNY paid Oracle $600M for its HR software (2013) (169 points | 90 comments)
2. Why wordfreq will not be updated (940 points | 296 comments)
3. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (113 points | 61 comments)
4. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (50 points | 8 comments)
5. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1352 points | 645 comments)
6. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (84 points | 40 comments)
7. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (73 points | 13 comments)
8. Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models (7 points | 1 comment)
9. Show HN: Selectric – macOS Search for Gmail, Outlook, Drive, Slack (19 points | 22 comments)
10. RabbitMQ 4.0 Released (89 points | 26 comments)
11. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (64 points | 46 comments)
12. Meta AI: "The Future of AI Is Open Source and Decentralized" (26 points | 11 comments)
13. Holding a Program in One's Head (2007) (27 points | 12 comments)
14. The Dune Shell (105 points | 28 comments)
15. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (163 points | 63 comments)
16. Senate Vote Tomorrow Could Give Helping Hand to Patent Trolls (38 points | 6 comments)
17. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (31 points | 14 comments)
18. Twitter shut off API access; users volunteering their own data for an open API (58 points | 38 comments)
19. GM electric vehicles can now access Tesla Superchargers (36 points | 13 comments)
20. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (566 points | 306 comments)
21. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (366 points | 151 comments)
22. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (715 points | 194 comments)
23. Valkey 8.0.0 Is Out (42 points | 14 comments)
24. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (46 points | 3 comments)
25. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (516 points | 183 comments)
26. PeerTube 6.3 (129 points | 8 comments)
27. AI tool cuts unexpected deaths in hospital by 26%, Canadian study finds (166 points | 133 comments)
28. How Raw sockets behave differently in macOS and Linux (87 points | 35 comments)
29. Putting Code on a Nerves Device (14 points | discuss)
30. Show HN: Sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (112 points | 19 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
